body.p:
Louis
Louisville Ky Decr 9th/61
To His Excellency.
Gov B. Magoffin,
Dear Sir,

I have known Mr W. J. Peto. for the last thirteen years, and have never known him to have been in a difficulty before; I having served nine years in the police Department of this city, and know him to be a good and law abiding citizen, any favor you may extend to him, will be thankfully received and duly reciprocated, he is all O.K --

Your humble Servent
R. M. Moore

It is true as stated in Petition that many persons in the city carry concealed weapons; & I believe it is also true that Pettiioner is in a verry Moderate Circumstances, I know him to be a civil quiet man & good citizen

Geo. W. Johnston
O H Strattan Clk C C L

Louisville City Ct
$10 } assault
$50 } Weapons
Wm J Peto
Issd Decr 18 1861

To his Excelency
B. Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Wm J. Peto would most Respectfully State to your exelency that he was fined by a Jury of the city Court of Louisville upon a charge of assault and battery upon one A. Dubourg the sum of $1000 & costs of said court also was fined by a Jurt of said court the sum of $5000 for carrying a concealed deadly weapon, and would respectfully ask your excelency to remit said fines as he considers himself justifiable in making the assault having been aggravated by a good and sufficient cause by words &c from said Dubourg and thinks that under the present troubles of the Country he has a right to carry some weapon of defense and would Therefore Respectfully request your Exelency to remit said fines as it is a custom with almost every man in this city to carry some weapon of defence and further that I am a poor man and wholly unable
at this time to pay the same having a family to support
We the undersigned heartily join in the above request and hope that his Excelency B. Magoffin will remit the above and foregoing mentioned fines imposed upon said Petitioner -- Wm J. Peto

Mrs M. Laporte
M. h Richardson
J. T. Waterhouse
Benjamin Dran
J T S. Brown
John G Baxter
J. M. Wells
Chrs Borie
E. N. Gibbs
A Borie
Mrs. A. B. Waterhouse
W. N. Mayfield
C Davis
John Ashcraft
M. J. Paul
